reviews.text: I highly recommend this museum! It is excellent. From the exhibits to the butterfly room, this place has so much for kids to see and do. I took my 2 month old and we even found hidden corners for the littlest of scientists! The butterfly exhibit is an extra fee, if you love butterflies it's a nice experience. The solar system room was our favorite and our little one loved the moving dinosaur! There was so much to see and do. Kids of all ages will really love this one.

A great place for kids!  Adults can definitely enjoy as well. I think it is catered more to kids, but there are more activities than average(much better than Liberty Science Center) that adults can enjoy. It is definitely the best science museum I went to as an adult. I enjoyed it as a non parent. Advice to adults -  go early!
Fun place for the kids. Lots of cool exhibits. The cost of admission is very reasonable. Went through the whole museum in around 3 hours. Definitely will be back

I can’t imagine how anyone could have a bad experience here. It’s totally worth it. I have a membership for me and my children and it’s worth every cent. We come throughout the year for their themed celebrations/events, they have an awesome butterfly room, a theater room, multiple levels with easy and rapid elevator access for each separate category of science... it covers every base. With our membership we are able to go all year round, with some discounts and only pay $5 to park every time so it stays affordable. We also get free entry to Mystic Aquarium for the month of March, free entry to Norwalk Aquarium in January, and free entry to Beardsley Zoo in Bridgeport come September. It’s totally worth it.. my son loves the Space room with the planets, and spaceship.. everything is so interactive and friendly. Highly recommend.
Great place to take the whole family. Lots of things to check out and explore. Great interactive displays. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Would definitely go back again.
Not worth the charge. Up keep poor  and very little to see. Paul lawerenc Dunbar house is much better and free.
Great discussion and film. Excellent tour guides. Just not handicapped accessible.
Interesting literary house museum in the Walnut Hills neighborhood. The local community has a cool history as well.
Great experience visiting this house on a Saturday morning and learning about its history. The guides were very helpful explaining things to us during the tour.
A really good place to learn about slavery era

The place is large and well organized, when you enter someone tells you where you should go. The duration in depends on how fast you see things but it is between half an hour and an hour. On the second floor there are many fun and educational activities for children. 
We went today because it was free the entrance but if you have to pay l don’t know how much.
Really wonderful facility with great collections and interpretation. A one-stop shop for learning about the vast history of CT. Plus the rotating exhibit at the time was exceptionally well done.
Great place to relive historical artifacts. It is always an amazing experience here. Love it. 5 stars for sure.
We visited on Smithsonian Museum Day.  We came for the tavern sign exhibit but found a number of other interesting exhibits while wandering around.

This place is a gem! The exhibits are beautiful and filled with amazing items from Connecticut's history. I have never seen such a diverse collection in such a beautiful setting.
We spent about 4 hours in the museum. We are going back to check out the library next time. It was easy to get to and there's loads of safe, free parking.

We had our wedding here at the carousel. 95 guests and it went spectacular. Everyone commented on how it was the best wedding they had ever been to. Staff was extremely helpful. If you are considering your wedding here. Do it!
A nice spot to have a family outing especially if there is an event going on. Nice for a walk or run and a little bit of bird or squirrel feeding. I played kick ball and baseball there with my kids.
I love it there my daughter has great time Everytime. And if there's an event even better but definitely would bring my family and friends I recommend it you will enjoy it
Love taking the kids here! Such a beautiful peace of history right there for us to enjoy. The new park is great 2! So unique and artistic with the touches of Hartford incorporated in all the pieces
Very good price on Saturday. 1$/person. The ride is about 5 min. The carousel is clean, neat, and colorful.
Not gonna lie - it was a let down after seeing the Springfield Armory.  But I have to admit that it was great to see that some of the original buildings have been repurposed into offices, etc.
An American icon..
Non operating stores and restaurants
Guzel şirin bir city .Universiteler sehri

Showed up early to have a sampling of the food for a late lunch.  It was all good.  Beer was cheap and because I had a great table to watch my favorite band compete (2 weeks ago) in the CT Blues Challenge, the entire band sat with me!  A great afternoon.  Friendly atmosphere, as all Blues venues are.

I traveled two hours to see the Nick Moss Band here recently. Great Blues band if you get a chance to see them. Reservations I strongly suggest here. The food & service were both outstanding & this place was jam packed with restaurant patrons. The brisket was excellent & my friend raved about the catfish. Check this place out. You won’t regret it. We had a great time eating at Sally's with friends. The atmosphere is fun, the wait staff did an outstanding job, and the food was very delicious. There is live music on weekdays in the evening, which probably makes the place crowded and loud (but fun). We can't wait to go back.

Black Eyed Sally's is one of the better spots we've eaten at in the Hartford area. 

The notion of a Louisiana-style restaurant in New England and the wonderfully garish decorations we encountered when we walked in had us on guard, but the hostess's warm welcome and table selection put us very much at ease. 

For one, the servers knew the food and helped us choose a good selection of appetizers and main courses. 

The dishes were well executed, tasty, and nicely plated. (Our leftover gumbo and collard greens were even better the following day!) 

All in all, the place was well run, the food was delicious. The place seemed legit. We'll happily go back there again soon.  (I hope they replace plastic straws and to-go containers with biodegradable ones soon.)

One of my favorites. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, the food is delicious, servers are pretty good with bringing your food out when its hot n ready. Its like being home. I do wish they had potato salad somewhere on the menu. But their lemonade and cornbread makes up for it😁😋

Everything is crazy good. So good in fact, I almost left my kids because they chose chicken fingers, then wanted to eat my ribs! They have to respect boundaries, am I right?!?!?!  Love blues was a total plus. Great gluten free choices. Next time I'm in Hartford, I'm coming back.

A fabulous place. Consistently very good to excellent food. Decent beer selection. Lively bar. Attentive, friendly service. One of our most frequent go-to spots. A Hartford institution, and rightfully so.
Great pizza.. cold beer... good service.. nice atmosphere
Great place to eat. Service is excellent and a family oriented. The menu is pretty big and prices are great. The only concern is that the parking is across a bussy road.

Their pizza is amazing! Great quality food, friendly staff and a great atmosphere for a date or for a family dinner/lunch. Parking can be tricky as they are full most of the time. They also have a nice bakery across the tavern, which is also very nice to sit and have dessert.
I've eaten here or from here on a it 5 occasions and I am not impressed. All their food seems to taste the same.  Service is fair, not great and the prices are ok

Came here for a work dinner, great food and great service. Would highly recommend. While it says its a steak house, a pretty impressive and broad menu with something for everyone Will def go back!. Food was stupendous.....service attentive and professional....not one person said, "No problem", when replying to "thank you". It was great to be back to this flagship restaurant. Options include a tavern menu in the whiskey bar area as well as eating in their contemporary dining room. Their tasty grilled salmon was prepared just right and portion size was ample. Service is attentive and efficient. They want to make your dining experience pleasurable and it shows.

I had a great time here celebrating my 10 month dating anniverary with my girlfriend. The tuna I got was excellent. My girlfriend liked the salmon. The hostess and waitress were both nice. We will come back again.

Had a great experience for Valentine's Day, made my girlfriend and I feel appreciated for coming. Food was fantastic and came out in good time. Had a couple issues with a drink order but they made sure we were taken care of and it made no impact on our great night. I'll definitely be back soon!

It was great to be back to this flagship restaurant. Options include a tavern menu in the whiskey bar area as well as eating in their contemporary dining room. Their tasty grilled salmon was prepared just right and portion size was ample. Service is attentive and efficient. They want to make your dining experience pleasurable and it shows. Came here for a work dinner, great food and great service. Would highly recommend. While it says its a steak house, a pretty impressive and broad menu with something for everyone Will def go back!.
Everything you can ask for. Fantastic Food and Service was faster than I expected. Really enjoyed my Dine and would love to recommend this place to my Friends and Family.

I had a pleasent experience here. I ordered the Shepard’s Pie, Guinness Stew, and a Guinness Brownie. I have to admire the food quality, the taste of the food was homemade and savory, and had a unique pub flavor to it. Vaughan’s is definitely going down as one of the best pubs in the Hartford area, if not one of the best in the state.
Fantastic place to enjoy Fine Dine and have Some Booze. Staff and Place is Nice  and Service was faster than  I expected. Location is Clean and Well maintained.
Typical Irish pub. Ok food. Typical bar food. Portions were small. Our waitress was MIA whenever we needed something but we managed. Well kept, nice bar, crowded to walk in. Especially on game days.
I love Vaughan's! Always great service and delicious food. Mostly lively crowd with a beautiful inviting bar!
Fun pub, good service, good prices. Would be 5 stars if they weren't out of all the appetizers I wanted to order.

AMAZING EXPERIENCE! All the staff from the door man to our server and bartender were awesome! Our food was spectacular, fast, and delicious. The service was super fast and friendly. This was all on the day of the Super Bowl parade so it was insanely busy and still everything was great. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

Best bar in Boston, if you like a pub feel! The staff here are delightful and outrageously accommodating, and the food discounts on Wednesday, Thursday, and Saturday genuinely made my jaw drop. Everything here is somehow cheaper than at normal Boston bars, but equally as tasty.

Best place in Boston for a cheap and quick burguer/beer combo! Lots of college crowd as well as old timers as myself. Happy environment, great place for watching sports! Breakfast served all day. Breakfast burger with over easy egg is a must have!
Great dive bar - food really great and cheap. Even had some salad selections! Beer was pricy ($7 for a standard Guinness) but glad I was here. Good breakfast as well. Bathroom was a little gross.
Always an awesome breakfast for not a lot of money. Friendly service. Definitely a go to
